Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the identity of the user that raised the event.
Docs.value: The identity of the user that is raising the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is evaluated by the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.HandleExternalEventActivity> activity. If the value that is set in the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.HandleExternalEventActivity.Roles%2A> property of this activity does not match any of the roles associated with the user identity, the activity is not allowed to execute.
The entity that raises the event can be a person or a computer.
Identity is used by the Roles functionality to ensure that this identity is allowed to submit data to this workflow.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the workflow instance identifier for the workflow instance that contains the that is expected to handle the event.
Docs.value: The workflow instance identifier for the workflow instance that contains the that is expected to handle the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a required property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the event should be raised immediately, or if the workflow should go idle before raising the event.
Docs.value: if the workflow should go idle before raising the event; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default value is `false`.
A value of `true` indicates that data was submitted to the workflow using <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.EnqueueItemOnIdle%2A>. A value of `false` indicates that data was submitted to the workflow using <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.EnqueueItem%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the to allow the external code, raising the event, to participate in the batch.
Docs.value: The to allow the external code, raising the event, to participate in the batch.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains the external code that raises the event.
Docs.value: The object that contains the external code that raises the event.
